00049 #define __TBB_BAD_ALLOC reinterpret_cast<void*>(63)

00058 
00059     class concurrent_vector_base_v3 {
00060     protected:
00061 
00062         // Basic types declarations
00063         typedef size_t segment_index_t;
00064         typedef size_t size_type;
00065 
00066         // Using enumerations due to Mac linking problems of static const variables
00067         enum {
00068             // Size constants
00069             default_initial_segments = 1, // 2 initial items
00071             pointers_per_short_table = 3, // to fit into 8 words of entire structure
00072             pointers_per_long_table = sizeof(segment_index_t) * 8 // one segment per bit
00073         };
00074 
00075         // Segment pointer. Can be zero-initialized
00076         struct segment_t {
00077             void* array;
00078 #if TBB_USE_ASSERT
00079             ~segment_t() {
00080                 __TBB_ASSERT( array <= __TBB_BAD_ALLOC, "should have been freed by clear" );
00081             }
00082 #endif /* TBB_USE_ASSERT */
00083         };
00084  
00085         // Data fields
00086 
00088         void* (*vector_allocator_ptr)(concurrent_vector_base_v3 &, size_t);
00089 
00091         atomic<size_type> my_first_block;
00092 
00094         atomic<size_type> my_early_size;
00095 
00097         atomic<segment_t*> my_segment;
00098 
00100         segment_t my_storage[pointers_per_short_table];
00101 
00102         // Methods
00103 
00104         concurrent_vector_base_v3() {
00105             my_early_size = 0;
00106             my_first_block = 0; // here is not default_initial_segments
00107             for( segment_index_t i = 0; i < pointers_per_short_table; i++)
00108                 my_storage[i].array = NULL;
00109             my_segment = my_storage;
00110         }
00111         __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD ~concurrent_vector_base_v3();
00112 
00113         static segment_index_t segment_index_of( size_type index ) {
00114             return segment_index_t( __TBB_Log2( index|1 ) );
00115         }
00116 
00117         static segment_index_t segment_base( segment_index_t k ) {
00118             return (segment_index_t(1)<<k & ~segment_index_t(1));
00119         }
00120 
00121         static inline segment_index_t segment_base_index_of( segment_index_t &index ) {
00122             segment_index_t k = segment_index_of( index );
00123             index -= segment_base(k);
00124             return k;
00125         }
00126 
00127         static size_type segment_size( segment_index_t k ) {
00128             return segment_index_t(1)<<k; // fake value for k==0
00129         }
00130 
00132         typedef void (__TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC *internal_array_op1)(void* begin, size_type n );
00133 
00135         typedef void (__TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC *internal_array_op2)(void* dst, const void* src, size_type n );
00136 
00138         struct internal_segments_table {
00139             segment_index_t first_block;
00140             void* table[pointers_per_long_table];
00141         };
00142 
00143         void __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_reserve( size_type n, size_type element_size, size_type max_size );
00144         size_type __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_capacity() const;
00145         void __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_grow_to_at_least( size_type new_size, size_type element_size, internal_array_op2 init, const void *src );
00146         void internal_grow( size_type start, size_type finish, size_type element_size, internal_array_op2 init, const void *src );
00147         size_type __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_grow_by( size_type delta, size_type element_size, internal_array_op2 init, const void *src );
00148         void* __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_push_back( size_type element_size, size_type& index );
00149         segment_index_t __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_clear( internal_array_op1 destroy );
00150         void* __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_compact( size_type element_size, void *table, internal_array_op1 destroy, internal_array_op2 copy );
00151         void __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_copy( const concurrent_vector_base_v3& src, size_type element_size, internal_array_op2 copy );
00152         void __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_assign( const concurrent_vector_base_v3& src, size_type element_size,
00153                               internal_array_op1 destroy, internal_array_op2 assign, internal_array_op2 copy );
00154         void __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_throw_exception(size_type) const;
00155         void __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_swap(concurrent_vector_base_v3& v);
00156 
00157 private:
00159         class helper;
00160         friend class helper;
00161     };
00162     
00163     typedef concurrent_vector_base_v3 concurrent_vector_base;
00164

00168     template<typename Container, typename Value>
00169     class vector_iterator 
00170     {
00172         Container* my_vector;
00173 
00175         size_t my_index;
00176 
00178 
00179         mutable Value* my_item;
00180 
00181         template<typename C, typename T>
00182         friend vector_iterator<C,T> operator+( ptrdiff_t offset, const vector_iterator<C,T>& v );
00183 
00184         template<typename C, typename T, typename U>
00185         friend bool operator==( const vector_iterator<C,T>& i, const vector_iterator<C,U>& j );
00186 
00187         template<typename C, typename T, typename U>
00188         friend bool operator<( const vector_iterator<C,T>& i, const vector_iterator<C,U>& j );
00189 
00190         template<typename C, typename T, typename U>
00191         friend ptrdiff_t operator-( const vector_iterator<C,T>& i, const vector_iterator<C,U>& j );
00192     
00193         template<typename C, typename U>
00194         friend class internal::vector_iterator;
00195 
00196 #if !defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
00197         template<typename T, class A>
00198         friend class tbb::concurrent_vector;
00199 #else
00200 public: // workaround for MSVC
00201 #endif 
00202 
00203         vector_iterator( const Container& vector, size_t index ) : 
00204             my_vector(const_cast<Container*>(&vector)), 
00205             my_index(index), 
00206             my_item(NULL)
00207         {}
00208 
00209     public:
00211         vector_iterator() : my_vector(NULL), my_index(~size_t(0)), my_item(NULL) {}
00212 
00213         vector_iterator( const vector_iterator<Container,typename Container::value_type>& other ) :
00214             my_vector(other.my_vector),
00215             my_index(other.my_index),
00216             my_item(other.my_item)
00217         {}
00218 
00219         vector_iterator operator+( ptrdiff_t offset ) const {
00220             return vector_iterator( *my_vector, my_index+offset );
00221         }
00222         vector_iterator &operator+=( ptrdiff_t offset ) {
00223             my_index+=offset;
00224             my_item = NULL;
00225             return *this;
00226         }
00227         vector_iterator operator-( ptrdiff_t offset ) const {
00228             return vector_iterator( *my_vector, my_index-offset );
00229         }
00230         vector_iterator &operator-=( ptrdiff_t offset ) {
00231             my_index-=offset;
00232             my_item = NULL;
00233             return *this;
00234         }
00235         Value& operator*() const {
00236             Value* item = my_item;
00237             if( !item ) {
00238                 item = my_item = &my_vector->internal_subscript(my_index);
00239             }
00240             __TBB_ASSERT( item==&my_vector->internal_subscript(my_index), "corrupt cache" );
00241             return *item;
00242         }
00243         Value& operator[]( ptrdiff_t k ) const {
00244             return my_vector->internal_subscript(my_index+k);
00245         }
00246         Value* operator->() const {return &operator*();}
00247 
00249         vector_iterator& operator++() {
00250             size_t k = ++my_index;
00251             if( my_item ) {
00252                 // Following test uses 2's-complement wizardry
00253                 if( (k& (k-2))==0 ) {
00254                     // k is a power of two that is at least k-2
00255                     my_item= NULL;
00256                 } else {
00257                     ++my_item;
00258                 }
00259             }
00260             return *this;
00261         }
00262 
00264         vector_iterator& operator--() {
00265             __TBB_ASSERT( my_index>0, "operator--() applied to iterator already at beginning of concurrent_vector" ); 
00266             size_t k = my_index--;
00267             if( my_item ) {
00268                 // Following test uses 2's-complement wizardry
00269                 if( (k& (k-2))==0 ) {
00270                     // k is a power of two that is at least k-2  
00271                     my_item= NULL;
00272                 } else {
00273                     --my_item;
00274                 }
00275             }
00276             return *this;
00277         }
00278 
00280         vector_iterator operator++(int) {
00281             vector_iterator result = *this;
00282             operator++();
00283             return result;
00284         }
00285 
00287         vector_iterator operator--(int) {
00288             vector_iterator result = *this;
00289             operator--();
00290             return result;
00291         }
00292 
00293         // STL support
00294 
00295         typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
00296         typedef Value value_type;
00297         typedef Value* pointer;
00298         typedef Value& reference;
00299         typedef std::random_access_iterator_tag iterator_category;
00300     };
00301 
00302     template<typename Container, typename T>
00303     vector_iterator<Container,T> operator+( ptrdiff_t offset, const vector_iterator<Container,T>& v ) {
00304         return vector_iterator<Container,T>( *v.my_vector, v.my_index+offset );
00305     }
00306 
00307     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00308     bool operator==( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00309         return i.my_index==j.my_index;
00310     }
00311 
00312     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00313     bool operator!=( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00314         return !(i==j);
00315     }
00316 
00317     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00318     bool operator<( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00319         return i.my_index<j.my_index;
00320     }
00321 
00322     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00323     bool operator>( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00324         return j<i;
00325     }
00326 
00327     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00328     bool operator>=( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00329         return !(i<j);
00330     }
00331 
00332     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00333     bool operator<=( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00334         return !(j<i);
00335     }
00336 
00337     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00338     ptrdiff_t operator-( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00339         return ptrdiff_t(i.my_index)-ptrdiff_t(j.my_index);
00340     }

00342     template<typename T, class A>
00343     class allocator_base {
00344     public:
00345         typedef typename A::template
00346             rebind<T>::other allocator_type;
00347         allocator_type my_allocator;
00348 
00349         allocator_base(const allocator_type &a = allocator_type() ) : my_allocator(a) {}
00350     };

00356 
00411 template<typename T, class A>
00412 class concurrent_vector: protected internal::allocator_base<T, A>,
00413                          private internal::concurrent_vector_base_v3 {
00414 private:
00415     template<typename I>
00416     class generic_range_type: public blocked_range<I> {
00417     public:
00418         typedef T value_type;
00419         typedef T& reference;
00420         typedef const T& const_reference;
00421         typedef I iterator;
00422         typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
00423         generic_range_type( I begin_, I end_, size_t grainsize = 1) : blocked_range<I>(begin_,end_,grainsize) {} 
00424         template<typename U>
00425         generic_range_type( const generic_range_type<U>& r) : blocked_range<I>(r.begin(),r.end(),r.grainsize()) {} 
00426         generic_range_type( generic_range_type& r, split ) : blocked_range<I>(r,split()) {}
00427     };
00428 
00429     template<typename C, typename U>
00430     friend class internal::vector_iterator;
00431 public:
00432     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00433     // STL compatible types
00434     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00435     typedef internal::concurrent_vector_base_v3::size_type size_type;
00436     typedef typename internal::allocator_base<T, A>::allocator_type allocator_type;
00437 
00438     typedef T value_type;
00439     typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
00440     typedef T& reference;
00441     typedef const T& const_reference;
00442     typedef T *pointer;
00443     typedef const T *const_pointer;
00444 
00445     typedef internal::vector_iterator<concurrent_vector,T> iterator;
00446     typedef internal::vector_iterator<concurrent_vector,const T> const_iterator;
00447 
00448 #if !defined(_MSC_VER) || _CPPLIB_VER>=300 
00449     // Assume ISO standard definition of std::reverse_iterator
00450     typedef std::reverse_iterator<iterator> reverse_iterator;
00451     typedef std::reverse_iterator<const_iterator> const_reverse_iterator;
00452 #else
00453     // Use non-standard std::reverse_iterator
00454     typedef std::reverse_iterator<iterator,T,T&,T*> reverse_iterator;
00455     typedef std::reverse_iterator<const_iterator,T,const T&,const T*> const_reverse_iterator;
00456 #endif /* defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER<1300) */
00457 
00458     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00459     // Parallel algorithm support
00460     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00461     typedef generic_range_type<iterator> range_type;
00462     typedef generic_range_type<const_iterator> const_range_type;
00463 
00464     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00465     // STL compatible constructors & destructors
00466     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00467 
00469     explicit concurrent_vector(const allocator_type &a = allocator_type())
00470         : internal::allocator_base<T, A>(a)
00471     {
00472         vector_allocator_ptr = &internal_allocator;
00473     }
00474 
00476     concurrent_vector( const concurrent_vector& vector, const allocator_type& a = allocator_type() )
00477         : internal::allocator_base<T, A>(a)
00478     {
00479         vector_allocator_ptr = &internal_allocator;
00480         internal_copy(vector, sizeof(T), &copy_array);
00481     }
00482 
00484     template<class M>
00485     concurrent_vector( const concurrent_vector<T, M>& vector, const allocator_type& a = allocator_type() )
00486         : internal::allocator_base<T, A>(a)
00487     {
00488         vector_allocator_ptr = &internal_allocator;
00489         internal_copy(vector.internal_vector_base(), sizeof(T), &copy_array);
00490     }
00491 
00493     explicit concurrent_vector(size_type n)
00494     {
00495         vector_allocator_ptr = &internal_allocator;
00496         if ( !n ) return;
00497         internal_reserve(n, sizeof(T), max_size()); my_early_size = n;
00498         __TBB_ASSERT( my_first_block == segment_index_of(n-1)+1, NULL );
00499         initialize_array(static_cast<T*>(my_segment[0].array), NULL, n);
00500     }
00501 
00503     concurrent_vector(size_type n, const_reference t, const allocator_type& a = allocator_type())
00504         : internal::allocator_base<T, A>(a)
00505     {
00506         vector_allocator_ptr = &internal_allocator;
00507         internal_assign( n, t );
00508     }
00509 
00511     template<class I>
00512     concurrent_vector(I first, I last, const allocator_type &a = allocator_type())
00513         : internal::allocator_base<T, A>(a)
00514     {
00515         vector_allocator_ptr = &internal_allocator;
00516         internal_assign(first, last, static_cast<is_integer_tag<std::numeric_limits<I>::is_integer> *>(0) );
00517     }
00518 
00520     concurrent_vector& operator=( const concurrent_vector& vector ) {
00521         if( this != &vector )
00522             concurrent_vector_base_v3::internal_assign(vector, sizeof(T), &destroy_array, &assign_array, &copy_array);
00523         return *this;
00524     }
00525 
00527     template<class M>
00528     concurrent_vector& operator=( const concurrent_vector<T, M>& vector ) {
00529         if( static_cast<void*>( this ) != static_cast<const void*>( &vector ) )
00530             concurrent_vector_base_v3::internal_assign(vector.internal_vector_base(),
00531                 sizeof(T), &destroy_array, &assign_array, &copy_array);
00532         return *this;
00533     }
00534 
00535     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00536     // Concurrent operations
00537     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00539 
00540     size_type grow_by( size_type delta ) {
00541         return delta ? internal_grow_by( delta, sizeof(T), &initialize_array, NULL ) : my_early_size;
00542     }
00543 
00545 
00546     size_type grow_by( size_type delta, const_reference t ) {
00547         return delta ? internal_grow_by( delta, sizeof(T), &initialize_array_by, static_cast<const void*>(&t) ) : my_early_size;
00548     }
00549 
00551     void grow_to_at_least( size_type n ) {
00552         if( my_early_size<n )
00553             internal_grow_to_at_least( n, sizeof(T), &initialize_array, NULL );
00554     };
00555 
00557     size_type push_back( const_reference item ) {
00558         size_type k;
00559         internal_loop_guide loop(1, internal_push_back(sizeof(T),k));
00560         loop.init(&item);
00561         return k;
00562     }
00563 
00565 
00567     reference operator[]( size_type index ) {
00568         return internal_subscript(index);
00569     }
00570 
00572     const_reference operator[]( size_type index ) const {
00573         return internal_subscript(index);
00574     }
00575 
00577     reference at( size_type index ) {
00578         return internal_subscript_with_exceptions(index);
00579     }
00580 
00582     const_reference at( size_type index ) const {
00583         return internal_subscript_with_exceptions(index);
00584     }
00585 
00587     range_type range( size_t grainsize = 1) {
00588         return range_type( begin(), end(), grainsize );
00589     }
00590 
00592     const_range_type range( size_t grainsize = 1 ) const {
00593         return const_range_type( begin(), end(), grainsize );
00594     }
00595     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00596     // Capacity
00597     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00599     size_type size() const {return my_early_size;}
00600 
00602     bool empty() const {return !my_early_size;}
00603 
00605     size_type capacity() const {return internal_capacity();}
00606 
00608 
00610     void reserve( size_type n ) {
00611         if( n )
00612             internal_reserve(n, sizeof(T), max_size());
00613     }
00614 
00616     void compact();
00617 
00619     size_type max_size() const {return (~size_type(0))/sizeof(T);}
00620 
00621     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00622     // STL support
00623     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00624 
00626     iterator begin() {return iterator(*this,0);}
00628     iterator end() {return iterator(*this,size());}
00630     const_iterator begin() const {return const_iterator(*this,0);}
00632     const_iterator end() const {return const_iterator(*this,size());}
00634     reverse_iterator rbegin() {return reverse_iterator(end());}
00636     reverse_iterator rend() {return reverse_iterator(begin());}
00638     const_reverse_iterator rbegin() const {return const_reverse_iterator(end());}
00640     const_reverse_iterator rend() const {return const_reverse_iterator(begin());}
00642     reference front() {
00643         __TBB_ASSERT( size()>0, NULL);
00644         return static_cast<T*>(my_segment[0].array)[0];
00645     }
00647     const_reference front() const {
00648         __TBB_ASSERT( size()>0, NULL);
00649         return static_cast<const T*>(my_segment[0].array)[0];
00650     }
00652     reference back() {
00653         __TBB_ASSERT( size()>0, NULL);
00654         return internal_subscript( my_early_size-1 );
00655     }
00657     const_reference back() const {
00658         __TBB_ASSERT( size()>0, NULL);
00659         return internal_subscript( my_early_size-1 );
00660     }
00662     allocator_type get_allocator() const { return this->my_allocator; }
00663 
00665     void assign(size_type n, const_reference t) { clear(); internal_assign( n, t ); }
00666 
00668     template<class I>
00669     void assign(I first, I last) {
00670         clear(); internal_assign( first, last, static_cast<is_integer_tag<std::numeric_limits<I>::is_integer> *>(0) );
00671     }
00672 
00674     void swap(concurrent_vector &vector) {
00675         if( this != &vector ) {
00676             concurrent_vector_base_v3::internal_swap(static_cast<concurrent_vector_base_v3&>(vector));
00677             std::swap(this->my_allocator, vector.my_allocator);
00678         }
00679     }
00680 
00682     void clear() {
00683         segment_t *table = my_segment;
00684         internal_free_segments( reinterpret_cast<void**>(table), internal_clear(&destroy_array), my_first_block );
00685         my_first_block = 0; // here is not default_initial_segments
00686     }
00687 
00689     ~concurrent_vector() {
00690         clear();
00691         // base class destructor call should be then
00692     }
00693 
00694     const internal::concurrent_vector_base_v3 &internal_vector_base() const { return *this; }
00695 private:
00697     static void *internal_allocator(internal::concurrent_vector_base_v3 &vb, size_t k) {
00698         return static_cast<concurrent_vector<T, A>&>(vb).my_allocator.allocate(k);
00699     }
00701     void internal_free_segments(void *table[], segment_index_t k, segment_index_t first_block);

00713     template<bool B> class is_integer_tag;
00714 
00716     template<class I>
00717     void internal_assign(I first, I last, is_integer_tag<true> *) {
00718         internal_assign(static_cast<size_type>(first), static_cast<T>(last));
00719     }
00721     template<class I>
00722     void internal_assign(I first, I last, is_integer_tag<false> *) {
00723         internal_assign_iterators(first, last);
00724     }

00727     void internal_assign_iterators(I first, I last);

00730     static void __TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC initialize_array( void* begin, const void*, size_type n );
00731 
00733     static void __TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC initialize_array_by( void* begin, const void* src, size_type n );
00734 
00736     static void __TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC copy_array( void* dst, const void* src, size_type n );
00737 
00739     static void __TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC assign_array( void* dst, const void* src, size_type n );
00740 
00742     static void __TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC destroy_array( void* begin, size_type n );
00743 
00745     class internal_loop_guide {
00746     public:
00747         const pointer array;
00748         const size_type n;
00749         size_type i;
00750         internal_loop_guide(size_type ntrials, void *ptr)
00751             : array(static_cast<pointer>(ptr)), n(ntrials), i(0) {}
00752         void init() {   for(; i < n; ++i) new( &array[i] ) T(); }
00753         void init(const void *src) { for(; i < n; ++i) new( &array[i] ) T(*static_cast<const T*>(src)); }
00754         void copy(const void *src) { for(; i < n; ++i) new( &array[i] ) T(static_cast<const T*>(src)[i]); }
00755         void assign(const void *src) { for(; i < n; ++i) array[i] = static_cast<const T*>(src)[i]; }
00756         template<class I> void iterate(I &src) { for(; i < n; ++i, ++src) new( &array[i] ) T( *src ); }
00757         ~internal_loop_guide() {
00758             if(i < n) // if exception raised, do zerroing on the rest of items
00759                 std::memset(array+i, 0, (n-i)*sizeof(value_type));
00760         }
00761     };
00762 };
00763 
00764 template<typename T, class A>
00765 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::compact() {
00766     internal_segments_table old;
00767     try {
00768         if( internal_compact( sizeof(T), &old, &destroy_array, &copy_array ) )
00769             internal_free_segments( old.table, pointers_per_long_table, old.first_block ); // free joined and unnecessary segments
00770     } catch(...) {
00771         if( old.first_block ) // free segment allocated for compacting. Only for support of exceptions in ctor of user T[ype]
00772             internal_free_segments( old.table, 1, old.first_block );
00773         throw;
00774     }
00775 }
00776 
00777 template<typename T, class A>
00778 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::internal_free_segments(void *table[], segment_index_t k, segment_index_t first_block) {
00779     // Free the arrays
00780     while( k > first_block ) {
00781         --k;
00782         T* array = static_cast<T*>(table[k]);
00783         table[k] = NULL;
00784         if( array > __TBB_BAD_ALLOC ) // check for correct segment pointer
00785             this->my_allocator.deallocate( array, segment_size(k) );
00786     }
00787     T* array = static_cast<T*>(table[0]);
00788     if( array > __TBB_BAD_ALLOC ) {
00789         __TBB_ASSERT( first_block > 0, NULL );
00790         while(k > 0) table[--k] = NULL;
00791         this->my_allocator.deallocate( array, segment_size(first_block) );
00792     }
00793 }
00794 
00795 template<typename T, class A>
00796 T& concurrent_vector<T, A>::internal_subscript( size_type index ) const {
00797     __TBB_ASSERT( index<size(), "index out of bounds" );
00798     size_type j = index;
00799     segment_index_t k = segment_base_index_of( j );
00800     // no need in __TBB_load_with_acquire since thread works in own space or gets 
00801 #if TBB_USE_THREADING_TOOLS
00802     return static_cast<T*>( tbb::internal::itt_load_pointer_v3(&my_segment[k].array))[j];
00803 #else
00804     return static_cast<T*>(my_segment[k].array)[j];
00805 #endif /* TBB_USE_THREADING_TOOLS */
00806 }
00807 
00808 template<typename T, class A>
00809 T& concurrent_vector<T, A>::internal_subscript_with_exceptions( size_type index ) const {
00810     if( index >= size() )
00811         internal_throw_exception(0); // throw std::out_of_range
00812     size_type j = index;
00813     segment_index_t k = segment_base_index_of( j );
00814     if( my_segment == (segment_t*)my_storage && k >= pointers_per_short_table )
00815         internal_throw_exception(1); // throw std::out_of_range
00816     void *array = my_segment[k].array; // no need in __TBB_load_with_acquire
00817     if( array <= __TBB_BAD_ALLOC ) // check for correct segment pointer
00818         internal_throw_exception(2); // throw std::range_error
00819     return static_cast<T*>(array)[j];
00820 }
00821 
00822 template<typename T, class A>
00823 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::internal_assign(size_type n, const_reference t)
00824 {
00825     if( !n ) return;
00826     internal_reserve(n, sizeof(T), max_size()); my_early_size = n;
00827     __TBB_ASSERT( my_first_block == segment_index_of(n-1)+1, NULL );
00828     initialize_array_by(static_cast<T*>(my_segment[0].array), static_cast<const void*>(&t), n);
00829 }
00830 
00831 template<typename T, class A> template<class I>
00832 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::internal_assign_iterators(I first, I last) {
00833     size_type n = std::distance(first, last);
00834     if( !n ) return;
00835     internal_reserve(n, sizeof(T), max_size()); my_early_size = n;
00836     __TBB_ASSERT( my_first_block == segment_index_of(n-1)+1, NULL );
00837     internal_loop_guide loop(n, my_segment[0].array); loop.iterate(first);
00838 }
00839 
00840 template<typename T, class A>
00841 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::initialize_array( void* begin, const void *, size_type n ) {
00842     internal_loop_guide loop(n, begin); loop.init();
00843 }
00844 
00845 template<typename T, class A>
00846 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::initialize_array_by( void* begin, const void *src, size_type n ) {
00847     internal_loop_guide loop(n, begin); loop.init(src);
00848 }
00849 
00850 template<typename T, class A>
00851 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::copy_array( void* dst, const void* src, size_type n ) {
00852     internal_loop_guide loop(n, dst); loop.copy(src);
00853 }
00854 
00855 template<typename T, class A>
00856 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::assign_array( void* dst, const void* src, size_type n ) {
00857     internal_loop_guide loop(n, dst); loop.assign(src);
00858 }
00859 
00860 template<typename T, class A>
00861 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::destroy_array( void* begin, size_type n ) {
00862     T* array = static_cast<T*>(begin);
00863     for( size_type j=n; j>0; --j )
00864         array[j-1].~T(); // destructors are supposed to not throw any exceptions
00865 }
00866 
00867 // concurrent_vector's template functions
00868 template<typename T, class A1, class A2>
00869 inline bool operator==(const concurrent_vector<T, A1> &a, const concurrent_vector<T, A2> &b) {
00870     //TODO[?]: deal with _Range_checked_iterator_tag of MSVC.
00871     // Simply:    return a.size() == b.size() && std::equal(a.begin(), a.end(), b.begin());
00872     if(a.size() != b.size()) return false;
00873     typename concurrent_vector<T, A1>::const_iterator i(a.begin());
00874     typename concurrent_vector<T, A2>::const_iterator j(b.begin());
00875     for(; i != a.end(); ++i, ++j)
00876         if( !(*i == *j) ) return false;
00877     return true;
00878 }
00879 
00880 template<typename T, class A1, class A2>
00881 inline bool operator!=(const concurrent_vector<T, A1> &a, const concurrent_vector<T, A2> &b)
00882 {    return !(a == b); }
00883 
00884 template<typename T, class A1, class A2>
00885 inline bool operator<(const concurrent_vector<T, A1> &a, const concurrent_vector<T, A2> &b)
00886 {    return (std::lexicographical_compare(a.begin(), a.end(), b.begin(), b.end())); }
00887 
00888 template<typename T, class A1, class A2>
00889 inline bool operator>(const concurrent_vector<T, A1> &a, const concurrent_vector<T, A2> &b)
00890 {    return b < a; }
00891 
00892 template<typename T, class A1, class A2>
00893 inline bool operator<=(const concurrent_vector<T, A1> &a, const concurrent_vector<T, A2> &b)
00894 {    return !(b < a); }
00895 
00896 template<typename T, class A1, class A2>
00897 inline bool operator>=(const concurrent_vector<T, A1> &a, const concurrent_vector<T, A2> &b)
00898 {    return !(a < b); }
00899 
00900 template<typename T, class A>
00901 inline void swap(concurrent_vector<T, A> &a, concurrent_vector<T, A> &b)
00902 {    a.swap( b ); }
00903
